prompt: Review the ECG shown. What do you do?

choices.label: Activate Cath Lab
choices.feedback: Correct--time-sensitive reperfusion.

choices.label: Treat GERD first
choices.feedback: Missed STEMI--delays reperfusion.

choices.label: CT abdomen
choices.feedback: Critical delay for ACS.

choices.label: Send them home
choices.feedback: Unsafe--misses a STEMI.

prompt: Child drank household bleach. Next best action?

choices.label: Send them home
choices.feedback: Unsafe--needs evaluation and airway monitoring.

choices.label: Administer activated charcoal
choices.feedback: Not recommended for caustic ingestions.

choices.label: Observe for symptoms and contact the regional poison control center
choices.feedback: Correct--observe for airway compromise and consult poison control.

choices.label: Obtain emergent GI consultation for endoscopy
choices.feedback: Not first-line without airway assessment and tox guidance.

choices.label: Induce emesis with syrup of ipecac
choices.feedback: Contraindicated; risk of re-exposure to caustic.

prompt: ECG today--presenting with chest pain that resolved, they look great. What do you want to do?

choices.label: Discharge with Pepcid/Maalox
choices.feedback: Missed Wellens pattern--high risk LAD lesion.

choices.label: Observe and order troponin
choices.feedback: Incomplete. Wellens requires urgent cardiology and avoidance of stress testing.

choices.label: Activate cath lab
choices.feedback: Correct--Wellens/reperfusion pattern concerning for LAD OMI/stenosis.

prompt: 28-year-old male twisted ankle playing soccer. Immediate pain/swelling with medial ankle tenderness. What do you want to do?

choices.label: Rest, ice, Motrin, send home
choices.feedback: Missed unstable ankle injury.

choices.label: XR ankle
choices.feedback: Incomplete--consider proximal fibula injury.

choices.label: XR ankle + tib/fib
choices.feedback: Correct--Maisonneuve fracture (prox fibula spiral fracture + unstable ankle). Evaluate syndesmosis/deltoid injury.

prompt: Take a look at this ECG. Patient with generalized weakness. What do you want to do?

choices.label: Give magnesium
choices.feedback: Not first-line for hyperkalemia ECG changes.

choices.label: Treat with transcutaneous pacing
choices.feedback: Address hyperkalemia first unless unstable bradycardia persists.

choices.label: Consult cardiology for EP evaluation / transfer
choices.feedback: Do not delay emergent hyperkalemia treatment.

choices.label: Activate the cath lab
choices.feedback: This is not STEMI; treat hyperkalemia.

choices.label: IV Calcium, Insulin, Lokelma
choices.feedback: Correct--stabilize myocardium and shift K.
